file_content.text: Will he be joining us?
In an advisory capacity. Pashna knows more about Zakuul than all of us put together.
What you did yesterday... I wouldn't have thought it possible. I want to help you do more.
A source of mine in the SIS entrusted Havoc with an interesting piece of intelligence not too long ago.
Our friend Jonas dropped me a little present a few weeks back.
I'm guessing we have Theron to thank for that, but it's the reason we're all here.
No comment.
The data identified a planetary transmitter within a Zakuul Knight outpost. Our mission is to plant a wiretap on that equipment.
Knowing what Arcann's up to could open up a lot of opportunities.
Sounds useful.
And then their secrets will be laid bare.
That will prove useful.
I assume we're getting more than premium holo-channels.
Could mean pay dirt.
What are you hoping to accomplish, Major?
To what end?
I'm sure the Eternal Throne will come crumbling down soon after.
Hardly a tide turner.
One brick at a time, but that's the idea.
We get a direct line on their communications, Havoc can start hitting high value targets all across the Spire.
And evade retaliation.
We'd be ghosts.
Deadly. Heavily armed. Ghosts.
This sounds like something Havoc Squad could have accomplished already.
Deploying the wiretap without it being discovered will either take a month of prep or a really big distraction.
If you're willing to commit the resources, we can move on this immediately.
We're in.
Everything shaping up like you planned, Theron?
You believe in this, Theron?
Well....
Straight answer.
The transmitter is a target we can hit and Havoc are the right ones to hit it. The sooner the better.
Pashna. What's the best way to get the Knights' attention?
What does the local think?
The only things that would require them to move in force would be widespread panic or evacuation.
Then it's decided. Send word to Odessen--we're going on the offensive.
We're in.
You're really going to attack the Spire?
Your people can handle the diversion. I want you along for the strike on the transmitter.
We're going to need every heavy hitter we can get, and you more than qualify.
Welcome back, sir.
The refugees have been trickling in. We're setting them up where we can, but I'm more concerned about supplies. This is a lot of mouths to feed.
Shelter and protection will have to do for now. We'll resume the mission tomorrow, after the refugees have settled in. Get some shut eye.
Understood, sir. You heard him, get this camp in order and tuck in!
This alliance may be your show to run, but those soldiers-- they're my responsibility. We clear?
A Jedi understands duty, Major. Do what's best for your team.
Totally.
You can bet I will.
This is a mutual arrangement. You help us, we help you. That's all.
Don't worry.
Just keep it above board.
I came for your cooperation, not your obedience.
I won't give you orders.
Hmm. You're not what I expected. Not entirely.
You'd take the whole galaxy's troubles on your shoulders if you could. I admire that.
You're a good man, Jorgan.
Just doing the job I signed up for.
I'm getting tired of your attitude, Jorgan.
Back off.
My attitude gets the job done. No excuses, no compromises.
I'm growing tired of this insolence.
Know your place.
Get used to it, Sith. I doubt we'll be seeing eye-to-eye.
She reminds me a lot of you.
What makes you say that?
How so?
Raw talent, star record, born leader and too big for her britches sometimes.
Have you been trying to replace me?
Missed me that bad?
I'd rather you not joke about that.
That why you made her your XO?
You have a soft spot?
Only because she reminds me of the good parts.
You don't have a thing for her, do you?
I don't think I like that.
Of course not.
She doesn't put up with your bull either?
We have the same dislikes?
She's more polite about it.
When they declared you KIA, I fought it.
I couldn't let go, they said. It almost earned me a psych discharge.
They threw our relationship in my face. Promised to overlook the "misconduct" if I dropped it. I was almost court martialed.
I was being stubborn, of course. It almost cost me my command.
As the years went by, I started to believe them.... Where have you been?
Frozen. Arcann kept me imprisoned in carbonite until the Alliance freed me.
So I've been the only one losing sleep.
There were dreams. I saw you die. I saw everyone die.
Now you know they were only nightmares.
Eventually.
No, I suppose we can't.
I've had a lot of time to think about us... I can give you some time, too.
For five years? I didn't think you could survive that long like that.
I almost didn't.
The bureaucrats would have preferred that, I'm sure. Raising you from the dead is going to require a lot of forms.
So will getting Havoc reinstated.
They won't like you either.
Only if I survive the court martial.
If it means never having to file a 57-NJ again, I might leave things the way they are.
I'm tempted to stay dead.
And here I thought you passed all that off on Elara.
They better hand over my new stripes. And my backpay.
I'm keeping the promotion.
I want to be there for that conversation.
I'll see you in the morning. Oh-seven-hundred.
You saved a lot of lives today.
Elara did her best, but she was on thin ice from day one. I ended up as CO. Took everything I had to keep Havoc from being picked apart.
We'll both sleep easier tonight.
[Flirt] Time for better dreams.
We can't just pick things back up where they left off. Too much time has passed.
Our time is past, Jorgan.
Just enough to get their attention. We don't have the forces for a real invasion yet.
Let's move out!
You're really going to attack Arcann's forces?
